nodes.text: The Moon Goddess was a deity worshiped by the Pantoran people.

Idols were made of the goddess, as well as two other figures, and put in personal shrines used by Pantoran individuals. Che Amanwe Papanoida used such an idol to defend herself against her kidnappers, which left a blood-stain on the base of the idol from which her father, Notluwiski Papanoida managed to track down one of them.
The idol of the Moon Goddess had a blue-painted moon on its crest, contrasting the other two idols on the shrine.
